class_notes:
This course invites you to reflect critically on a semester-long internship experience with a Latinx American-serving organization while not only engaging academically with topics common to intercultural communication and global workplace dynamics but also enhancing your ability to identify, understand, and adapt to professional discourses and cultural norms. PREREQUISITE: At least one Foundational Course (SPAN 300 to 318W)
Interested students must contact Prof. Robyn Clarke at hrclark@emory.edu.
course_description: Students receive credit for a semester-long internship with an organization that serves Spanish speakers. Class time invites students to reflect critically on experience using concepts common to intercultural communication and global workplace dynamics. Instructor permission required.
prerequisites: One 300 level SPAN or SPAN_OX course or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 5581, Section #: 1, Type: IND, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 1-1:50p, Instructor: R. Clarke, Status: Open
